headline: Ford Fails Again
summary: When Ford (NYSE:F) announced a $19.5 billion write-off on its electric vehicle business, shareholders didn’t panic. They exhaled. The stock barely flinched, trading near 52-week highs at $13.67, because investors were relieved Ford finally stopped burning cash on a battle it was never equipped to win. The write-off represents 36% of Ford’s entire $54.5 billion market ... Ford Fails Again

headline: Ford (F) Valuation Check After 41.66% Year-to-Date Share Price Rally
summary: Ford Motor (F) has quietly outperformed the broader auto sector this year, and that steady climb is catching investors attention as they weigh how much upside is left after a strong run. See our latest analysis for Ford Motor. With the share price now around $13.67 and a strong year to date share price return of 41.66 percent, momentum looks to be building, echoed by a 47.27 percent total shareholder return over the past year as investors warm to Ford’s execution on its strategy. headline: Did Ford’s EV Retrenchment and Hybrid Pivot Just Shift Ford Motor's (F) Investment Narrative?
summary: In December 2025, Ford Motor overhauled its Ford+ plan by cancelling several larger all‑electric vehicles, ending current F‑150 Lightning production, restructuring its SK On battery joint venture, and booking about US$19.5 billion in special items plus roughly US$3 billion tied to taking over Kentucky battery plants. Ford is redirecting this capital into hybrids, extended‑range electric trucks, smaller affordable EVs on its Universal EV Platform, a new battery energy storage business, and a...

headline: Heard on the Street Tuesday Recap: Late Jobs Report Still Leaves a Mark
